medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent fever, weight loss, and confusion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began four months prior to hospitalization, featuring persistent fever, significant weight loss (up to 35 lb), and progressive dementia. Two months after the onset of fever, the patient experienced dyspnea, productive cough, and hypoxemia, leading to his first hospitalization. Symptoms included profound fatigue, occasional headaches, and rare visual hallucinations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, benign prostatic hypertrophy, history of smoking (40 packs/year), major depression diagnosed a year prior, and surgical history of uncomplicated bilateral carotid endarterectomies and elective aortic aneurysm repair.
medical_history.social_history: Retired policeman, history of significant smoking.
